intro: Rangaeris schliebenii, commonly known as the Schlieben's rangaeris, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in rocky or alpine regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
